Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/China - Economic conditions
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/United States - Economic conditions
description: Episode number 13 of Series "The Global Economy". This episode of The Global Economy focuses on the changing nature of the world's various economies by considering two examples: China as a developing economy (Passing on development) and the USA (Continual change, continual growth) with its dominance of the computer software industry. A panel of economists discuss the nature of change in the local market place and the effects this creates globally.
